data.title: Mike Dunleavy Jr. joins Warriors staff as pro scout
data.meta_description: Former Warrior Mike Dunlevy Jr. has impressive basketball experience and joins the team's staff for 2018-19.
data.text:
15-year NBA veteran and former Warrior Mike Dunleavy Jr. highlights the team’s additions to the basketball operations staff, as he comes on board as a Pro Scout. Dunleavy averaged 11.2 points, 4.3 rebounds and 2.2 assists over his playing career in addition to taking home second-team All-American honors as a junior at Duke.

The son of former NBA player and coach Mike Dunleavy Sr., it’s hard to argue with the basketball pedigree of Dunleavy Jr.

Some other notable additions include Carl Bergstrom (Performance Coach), Brett Ballesteros (Assistant Athletic Trainer and Assistant Performance Coach), Gerry Ramogida (Performance Therapist) and Nick Kerr (Assistant Video Coordinator).

Bergstrom has worked with the MLS’ Vancouver Whitecaps, the NHL’s Vancouver Canucks, and with the Canadian Women’s Olympic Soccer team.

Ballesteros was with the Warriors during the 2014-15 championship season before working with Stanford’s football and track and field programs.

Ramogida has consulted for the Canucks as well as the NFL’s Seattle Seahawks, in addition to being on the staff of Canada’s Olympic and World Track and Field Championship teams.

Kerr served as a Quality Assurance Assistant with the Spurs last season after being a graduate assistant at Cal-Berkley, where he also played his final collegiate season.
